In preparation for this, we have coordinated with all of the local response agencies by providing information and facility tours annually to ensure that they are familiar with and properly prepared for an incident at our facility.  This will help to ensure that our community has the strategy for responding to and mitigating the threat posed by an LP Gas release.  This complies with the community Emergency Response Plan coordinated with our Local Emergency Management Agency.

To the best of the undersigned's knowledge, information and belief formed after reasonable inquiry, the information submitted is true, accurate and complete:

Program. 
Our Facility maintains a 30000 gallon bulk storage tank, at 80% max Capacity we have roughly 100,000 pounds of LP Gas on location.
THE WORST-CASE AND ALTERNATIVE RELEASE SCENARIO-
Our worst-case scenario is failure of the 30,000 gallon storage tank when filled to the greatest amount allowed (80% at 60F), resulting in a vapor cloud explosion. The resulting distance to the endpoint extends offsite and public receptors are within the distance to the endpoint.
Our Alternative release scenario is a hose rupture caused by a pull-away. A 25 foot unloading hose with a 4 diameter may break if a driver doesn't remove the hoses between the storage tank and the transfer vehicle. the active mitigation devices are assumed to work as designed, limiting the release to the contents of the hose. The release leads to a vapor cloud explosion with an endpoint of .03miles.
PREVENTION PROGRAM AND CHEMICAL-SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS
Training is provided to all employees every three years with a refresher review at least annually, whenever there is a change in the process, or whenever competency with the regulations is questioned.  Safety material is also offered for all LP Gas customers annually and offered to the local fire department personnel during their annual tour of our facility and operations.  Training courses consist of classroom lecture, current and approved videos or CD, testing both verbally and written, as well as demonstration and observation for each person working with the process to be certified while subsequent on the job training is always approved as well.
FIVE-YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY
There have been no accidents involving LP Gas that have resulted in deaths, recordable injuries, property or environmental damage, including evacuations on or off site.
THE EMERGENCY RESPONSE AND CONTINGENCY PLAN
In the event of an emergency involving our LP Gas system, it is our policy to notify the local community fire department and request that they respond to the

RMP Report for Rock County Agronomy Service, LLC
	Executive Summary-LP Gas
THE ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE & CONTINGENCY POLICIES FOR OUR FACILITY-
This facility adheres to all applicable federal, state, and local laws.
One of our company goals states, To provide for the Safety of our employees, our customers, the general public and to be good stewards of the environment for which we serve. To fulfill these goals, we enroll in regulatory management services that assist in maintaining and administering comprehensive safety and environmental programs, procedures, and training courses. We perform a thorough annual audit program and monitor facility compliance with the safety standards and oversight assistance with this specialty firm. The program consists of utilizing internal audit checklists and survey forms that are reviewed regularly and updated as necessary to ensure all applicable federal, state, and local regulations are covered.  These checklists are used to measure regulatory compliance, including those governing the safe handling and storage of LP Gas. Producers require a timely response and correction of all recommendations resulting from these audit checklists.
A Site Safety Coordinator is identified and used as an extension of the general manager and management service personnel for a hands on manager of the day to day safe working activities, to maintain the required regulatory recordkeeping, to conduct monthly safety meetings, to conduct employee training, and to act as the location's contact during emergency incidents that are rehearsed biannually.
A DESCRIPTION OF THE FACILITY AND THE REGULATED SUBSTANCES HANDLED-
The facility is a wholesale farm supply and distribution center and as such we store and distribute a wide variety of pesticides and fertilizers, including LP Gas.  LP Gas is received by truck, is handled and stored on site, and is a regulated substance requiring us to comply with EPA's Risk Management
